db:abstract.db:para: The QHelpSearchQueryWidget class provides a simple line edit or an advanced widget to enable the user to input a search term in a standardized input mask.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QHelpSearchQueryWidget::QHelpSearchQueryWidget(QWidget *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new search query widget with the given parent.

db:section.db:title: void QHelpSearchQueryWidget::collapseExtendedSearch()
db:section.db:para: Collapses the search query widget so that only the default search field is shown.

db:section.db:title: void QHelpSearchQueryWidget::expandExtendedSearch()
db:section.db:para: Expands the search query widget so that the extended search fields are shown.

db:section.db:title: QList<QHelpSearchQuery> QHelpSearchQueryWidget::query() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of queries to use in combination with the search engines search(QList<QHelpSearchQuery> &queryList) function.

db:section.db:title: void QHelpSearchQueryWidget::search()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when a the user has the search button invoked. After receiving the signal you can ask the QHelpSearchQueryWidget for the build list of QHelpSearchQuery's that you may pass to the QHelpSearchEngine's search() function.

db:section.db:title: void QHelpSearchQueryWidget::setQuery(const QList<QHelpSearchQuery> &queryList)
db:section.db:para: Sets the QHelpSearchQueryWidget input fields to the values specified by queryList search field name. Please note that one has to call the search engine's search(QList<QHelpSearchQuery> &queryList) function to perform the actual search.
